greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximum run of white (or OFF) cells in generation n of the Rule 30 elementary cellular automaton.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
example: First 12 rows, replacing "1" with ".", ignoring "0" outside of range of 1's, for better visibility of OFF cells, maximum number of contiguous OFF cells in each row appears at left:
mathematica: clip[lst_] := Block[{p = Flatten@ Position[lst, 1]}, Take[lst, {Min@ p, Max@ p}]]; Max /@ Map[Length@ # &, Map[Split@ # &, Map[clip, CellularAutomaton[30, {{1}, 0}, 98]]] /. 1 -> Nothing, {2}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 06 2015 *)
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Oct 31 2004
